subject: Date with Corinna
header: Are you a Perl fan? If yes then you are invited to meet Corinna, thanks to Curtis and his gangs. I have been stalking Corinna ever since Curtis introduced Corinna, previously known as Cor. It is the best thing happened in the recent times, in my humble opinion. I can't wait to see it becoming part of core Perl. But I know for a fact, it is going to be a long wait. I am sure it would be a worthy one. Before I forget I would like to share another gist by Curtis where he compared the performance of core, Moose, Moo, and Object::Pad. We are also informed that the :builder is now officially removed from the Corinna MVP. Be prepared, it may come back, but for now, it's dead as documented here.
Is that the only good news about Perl?

Well, the short answer is No. As we all know, very soon we would have Perl 7 made public. I am little unsure about the launch date. One thing is for sure, Perl 7 is coming first and then Corinna. Please correct me if I am wrong. I am optimistic about Perl future and confident that it is going to bounce back harder.
Please check out the rest of the newsletter for more fun news related to Perl family.

chapters.title: Perl Weekly Challenge
chapters.header: The Weekly Challenge by Mohammad Anwar will help you step out from your comfort zone. You can even win the prize money of a $50 Amazon voucher by participating in the weekly challenge. We pick one winner at the end of the month from all the contributors during that month. The monthly prize is kindly sponsored by Peter Sergeant of PerlCareers.

entries.author: mohammad_anwar
entries.text: Welcome to a new week with a couple of fun tasks "Chinese Zodiac" and "What's playing?". If you are new to the weekly challenge then why not join us and have fun every week. For more information, please read FAQ page.
entries.title: The Weekly Challenge - 103

entries.author: mohammad_anwar
entries.text: Enjoy a quick recap of last week's contributions by Team PWC dealing with the "Rare Numbers" and "Hash-counting String" tasks in Perl and Raku. You will find plenty of solutions to keep you busy.
entries.title: RECAP - The Weekly Challenge - 102

entries.author: aaron_smith
entries.text: As always, Aaron goes into the finer details of the task and takes us to the memorable journey.
entries.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 102

entries.author: abigail
entries.text: You don't read Abigail's blog just for its technical values. I love the story created around the task.
entries.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 102: Rare Numbers

entries.author: abigail
entries.text: I must admit Abigail made the task looks so simple and easy to follow.
entries.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 102: Hash-counting String

entries.author: adam_russell
entries.text: Enjoy the twist and turn by Adam as he is using threads. Very interesting approach.
entries.title: The Weekly Challenge 102: Threads and Recursion

entries.author: arne_sommer
entries.text: We all know Arne is Raku expert but his Perl skill equally great. I love his Perl solutions with the flavour of Raku.
entries.title: Rare Counting with Raku and Perl

entries.author: dave_jacoby
entries.text: Dave shared his fight with the weekly task. You learn a lot by just reading his experience.
entries.title: Rare Numbers and Hash: Perl Challenge #102

entries.author: flavio_poletti
entries.text: For me, the section "The questions" is more important than "The solution". He explained in great details.
entries.title: PWC102 - Rare Numbers

entries.author: flavio_poletti
entries.text: Flavio threw challenge to reader of his blog. Find out more about it.
entries.title: PWC102 - Hash-counting String

entries.author: james_smith
entries.text: Of all, I fall in love with the solution to the task 2. Very clever solution. Well done.
entries.title: Perl weekly challenge 102

entries.author: roger_bell_west
entries.text: Roger shared the performance of his solutions in Perl, Python and Ruby. Interesting stats.
entries.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 102: Rare Hash

entries.author: simon_green
entries.text: I love the honesty as Simon confessed his solution is not the most optimal solution. Please check out the whole story.
entries.title: Weekly Challenge 102

chapters.title: Perl Tutorial

The included articles are from the Perl Maven Tutorial and are part of the Perl Maven eBook.
